Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Near-Infrared Light Device for Peripheral Venous Catheter Placement in ICU Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: A total of 380 patients were randomised in a 1:1 ratio

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adult ICU patients with an existing CVC no longer indicated.

Intervention.evidence: randomised in a 1:1 ratio to either the near-infrared light device or the landmark approach

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether a near-infrared light device (AccuVein AV500) improves the first-attempt success rate of PVC placement compared to the landmark approach.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the first-attempt success rate of PVC placement, measured immediately after the attempt.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a centralised web-based system

Blinding.evidence: blinding was not possible due to the nature of the intervention

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 380 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis will be conducted on a modified intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Results: The trial is ongoing, and results are not yet available.

Harms.evidence: Results: The trial is ongoing, and results are not yet available.

Funding.evidence: The study is sponsored by the Hospital University Centre of Orléans, France.
